kpis.name: Acute Admissions Trend
kpis.description: Acute admissions have increased by 5% compared to the same period last year, reflecting strong underlying operational performance.

driverItems.headline: Increased demand for elective procedures
driverItems.description: Elective procedures have increased by 2% over the past year.

driverItems.headline: Increased number of referrals from primary care providers
driverItems.description: Referrals have increased by 1.5% over the past year.

driverItems.headline: Regional population growth
driverItems.description: The region has experienced a 1% population growth over the past year.

driverItems.headline: Non-issue
driverItems.description: Marketing spend - Marketing efforts have not significantly impacted the increase in acute admissions.

kpis.name: Observed/Expected LOS
kpis.description: The system's observed/expected LOS ratio was 1.0, matching the peer average.

driverItems.headline: Time to first diagnostic test
driverItems.description: The average time to first diagnostic test (CT, MRI, echo, etc.) has decreased by 10% over the past year.

driverItems.headline: % of patients with discharge disposition identified within 24 hours of admission
driverItems.description: This percentage has increased by 15% over the past year.

driverItems.headline: % of patients with LOS > expected x 2 StDev (outlier patients)
driverItems.description: The percentage of outlier patients has decreased by 5% over the past year.

kpis.name: Primetime OR Utilization Rate
kpis.description: Primetime OR utilization rate has increased by 5% compared to the same period last year, reflecting improved surgical operations efficiency.

driverItems.headline: First case on-time start %
driverItems.description: The percentage of first cases starting on time has increased by 8% over the past year.

driverItems.headline: Average case delay (minutes)
driverItems.description: The average case delay has decreased by 10 minutes over the past year.

driverItems.headline: Block utilization rate
driverItems.description: The block utilization rate has increased by 7% over the past year.

driverItems.headline: Non-issue
driverItems.description: Case cancellation rates - Case cancellation rates have not significantly impacted the primetime OR utilization rate.

kpis.name: Full Time Equivalents per AA
kpis.description: Full time equivalents per AA have decreased by 3% compared to the same period last year, indicating improved workforce efficiency.

chart.title: Full Time Equivalents per AA
chart.subtitle: Current Period vs. Prior Year, Cases

driverItems.headline: Increased productivity
driverItems.description: Productivity has increased by 4% over the past year.

driverItems.headline: Staffing ratios by department
driverItems.description: Staffing ratios have improved by 2% in key departments over the past year.

driverItems.headline: Average span of control
driverItems.description: The average number of direct reports per manager has increased by 1.5% over the past year.

kpis.name: Labor Cost per Full Time Equivalent / AA
kpis.description: Labor cost per full time equivalent / AA has decreased by 4% compared to the same period last year, reflecting cost-saving measures.

chart.title: Labor Cost per Full Time Equivalent / AA
chart.subtitle: Current Period vs. Budget, $USD

driverItems.headline: Overtime hours as a percentage of total hours
driverItems.description: Overtime hours have decreased by 1.5% over the past year.

driverItems.headline: Average hourly rate
driverItems.description: The average hourly rate has decreased by 2% over the past year.

driverItems.headline: Fringe benefit rate
driverItems.description: The fringe benefit rate has decreased by 0.5% over the past year.

kpis.name: Purchased Services Expenses per Equivalent Discharge
kpis.description: Purchased services expenses per equivalent discharge have decreased by 3% compared to the same period last year, reflecting cost-saving measures.

chart.title: Purchased Services Expenses per Equivalent Discharge
chart.subtitle: Current Period vs. Budget, Cases

driverItems.headline: Vendor contract renegotiations
driverItems.description: Renegotiated contracts have reduced expenses by 2% over the past year.

driverItems.headline: Increased use of in-house services
driverItems.description: Shifting services in-house has reduced expenses by 1% over the past year.

driverItems.headline: Improved vendor management
driverItems.description: Enhanced vendor management practices have reduced expenses by 0.5% over the past year.

driverItems.headline: Non-issue
driverItems.description: External economic conditions - Economic conditions have not significantly impacted purchased services expenses per equivalent discharge.

kpis.name: Supplies Expenses per Equivalent Discharge
kpis.description: Supplies expenses per equivalent discharge have decreased by 2% compared to the same period last year, reflecting cost-saving measures.

chart.title: Supplies Expenses per Equivalent Discharge
chart.subtitle: Current Period vs. Prior Year, Index

driverItems.headline: Bulk purchasing agreements
driverItems.description: Bulk purchasing has reduced supplies expenses by 1% over the past year.

driverItems.headline: Supply waste rate
driverItems.description: The cost of expired/discarded items as a percentage of total cost has decreased by 0.5% over the past year.

driverItems.headline: % of supply spend on preferred items/contracts
driverItems.description: The percentage of supply spend on preferred items/contracts has increased by 0.5% over the past year.

driverItems.headline: Non-issue
driverItems.description: Supplier price fluctuations - Price fluctuations from suppliers have not significantly impacted supplies

kpis.name: Pharmacy Expenses per Equivalent Discharge
kpis.description: Pharmacy expenses per equivalent discharge have decreased by 1.5% compared to the same period last year, reflecting cost-saving measures.

chart.title: Pharmacy Expenses per Equivalent Discharge
chart.subtitle: Current Period vs. Budget, $USD per Adjusted Admission

driverItems.headline: Use of generic drugs
driverItems.description: The use of generic drugs has increased by 10% over the past year.

driverItems.headline: Negotiated drug prices
driverItems.description: Better pricing agreements with suppliers have improved by 5% over the past year.

driverItems.headline: Improved formulary management
driverItems.description: Formulary management has improved by 8% over the past year, optimizing drug usage.

driverItems.headline: Non-issue
driverItems.description: Drug shortages - Drug shortages have not significantly impacted pharmacy expenses per equivalent discharge.

kpis.name: AR Days
kpis.description: AR days have decreased by 4% compared to the same period last year, reflecting improved revenue cycle management.

driverItems.headline: Percentage of AR > 90 days
driverItems.description: The percentage of AR > 90 days has decreased by 6% over the past year.

driverItems.headline: Percentage of bad debt and charity write-offs
driverItems.description: The percentage of bad debt and charity write-offs has decreased by 3% over the past year.

driverItems.headline: Denial rate
driverItems.description: The denial rate has decreased by 2% over the past year.

driverItems.headline: Non-issue
driverItems.description: DNFB days (discharged, not final billed) - DNFB days have not significantly impacted AR days.

kpis.name: Acute Admissions Trend:
kpis.description: What specific factors and initiatives have contributed to the 5% increase in acute admissions compared to the same period last year? How can we replicate these successful strategies across other departments and facilities to sustain and further enhance this growth? Are there particular service lines or patient demographics that have shown the most significant improvement, and what can we learn from them to apply to underperforming areas?

kpis.name: Observed/Expected LOS
kpis.description: What operational changes and clinical practices have led to the observed/expected LOS ratio matching the peer average at 1.0? How can we ensure these practices are standardized and implemented across all facilities to maintain and improve this performance? Are there specific departments or patient groups where these improvements are most pronounced, and what lessons can be applied to areas with higher LOS?

chart.title: Cost Management Report
chart.subtitle: Operating room usage rates and scheduling efficiency

kpis.name: Full Time Equivalents per AA
kpis.description: What factors have contributed to the 3% decrease in full-time equivalents per AA over the past year? How can we balance this reduction with maintaining or improving patient care quality and staff satisfaction? Are there specific departments or roles where this reduction has been most effective, and how can we replicate these efficiencies across the organization?

chart.subtitle: Uncompensated care trends and write-off rates

kpis.name: Labor Cost per Full Time Equivalent / AA
kpis.description: What strategies and initiatives have led to the 4% decrease in labor cost per full-time equivalent / AA over the past year? How can we ensure these cost-saving measures do not negatively impact staff morale and patient care quality? Are there specific areas where these cost reductions have been most effective, and what best practices can be shared across the organization?

chart.subtitle: Usage and cost of temporary staffing by unit

kpis.name: Purchased Services Expenses per Equivalent Discharge
kpis.description: What specific actions and negotiations have resulted in the 3% decrease in purchased services expenses per equivalent discharge over the past year? How can we continue to optimize these expenses while maintaining high-quality service delivery? Are there particular vendors or service categories where we have achieved the most significant savings, and how can we apply these strategies to other areas?

kpis.name: Acute Admissions Growth Exceeding Peers
kpis.description: Our facility's 5% increase in acute admissions outperforms the peer average growth of 2.3%, placing us in the top quartile of comparable facilities through strategic service line expansion and enhanced referral networks.

driverItems.headline: Strategic service line optimization
driverItems.description: Expanded elective procedure capacity resulting in 8.5% growth compared to peer average of 3.2% in surgical specialties.

driverItems.headline: Enhanced primary care network
driverItems.description: Implemented direct referral system with 42 affiliated practices, generating 15% more referrals than peer average.

driverItems.headline: Outreach program effectiveness
driverItems.description: Community health initiatives drove 12% increase in new patient acquisitions versus peer benchmark of 7%.

driverItems.headline: Non-issue
driverItems.description: Emergency department utilization was not a significant driver, with ED admissions at peer average (+0.2%). (pX)

chart.title: Revenue Analysis Report
chart.subtitle: Uncompensated care trends and write-off rates

sources.label: Hospital Operating Income Key Performance Metrics

chart.title: Hospital Operating Income Key Performance Metrics
chart.subtitle: Current Period, $USD

kpis.name: LOS Performance At Peer Benchmark
kpis.description: Our observed/expected LOS ratio of 1.0 matches the peer benchmark exactly, representing significant improvement from our previous performance through optimized discharge planning and case management.

driverItems.headline: Discharge planning improvements
driverItems.description: Implemented multidisciplinary rounds within 24 hours of admission, matching best-in-class peer practice implemented in 85% of cases versus peer average of 72%.

driverItems.headline: Diagnostic testing efficiency
driverItems.description: Reduced average time to first diagnostic test to 5.2 hours versus peer average of 6.8 hours, decreasing overall length of stay.

driverItems.headline: Case management optimization
driverItems.description: Improved case manager to patient ratio to 1:18 versus peer benchmark of 1:22, enabling earlier intervention for complex cases.

driverItems.headline: Non-issue
driverItems.description: Patient acuity was not a significant factor, with case mix index 2% above peer average. (pX)

chart.title: OR Utilization Review
chart.subtitle: Usage and cost of temporary staffing by unit

kpis.name: Workforce Efficiency Above Peer Average
kpis.description: Our 3% reduction in FTEs per AA exceeds peer average improvement of 1.5%, demonstrating superior workforce optimization through redesigned care models and effective cross-training programs.

driverItems.headline: Care model redesign
driverItems.description: Implemented team-based nursing model resulting in 5% lower RN hours per patient day compared to peer median.

driverItems.headline: Technology-enabled productivity
driverItems.description: Deployed AI-assisted clinical documentation in 85% of units versus peer adoption of 62%, reducing administrative time by 0.8 FTEs per unit.

driverItems.headline: Cross-training effectiveness
driverItems.description: Cross-trained 38% of support staff versus peer benchmark of 25%, enabling flexible deployment across departments.

driverItems.headline: Non-issue
driverItems.description: Staff experience levels did not negatively impact efficiency, with average tenure matching peer median at 6.3 years. (pX)

kpis.name: Labor Cost Management Outperforming Peers
kpis.description: Labor cost per FTE/AA has decreased by 4% compared to peer average reduction of 1.8%, placing us in the top 20% through premium pay reduction and skill mix optimization.

driverItems.headline: Premium pay reduction
driverItems.description: Reduced overtime to 3.2% of total hours versus peer benchmark of 4.7% through predictive scheduling algorithms.

driverItems.headline: Skill mix optimization
driverItems.description: Adjusted RN to support staff ratio to 65:35 versus peer average of 70:30, aligning with best practice benchmarks while maintaining quality outcomes.

driverItems.headline: Benefits structure efficiency
driverItems.description: Implemented tiered benefits program yielding 3.8% lower benefit costs per FTE compared to peer average.

driverItems.headline: Non-issue
driverItems.description: Base compensation rates were not a driver, as they remained aligned with market at 58th percentile versus peer median of 55th percentile. (pX)

chart.title: Sales Performance Review
chart.subtitle: Bed occupancy, procedure room use, and throughput metrics

chart.title: Admissions Key Performance Metrics
chart.subtitle: Current Period vs. Prior Year, Cases

kpis.name: Purchased Services Expense Reduction Leading Peers
kpis.description: Our 3% reduction in purchased services expenses exceeds the peer benchmark of 1.2%, delivering superior expense management through contract consolidation and strategic insourcing decisions.

driverItems.headline: Contract consolidation
driverItems.description: Reduced number of service vendors by 28% compared to peer average reduction of 15%, enhancing negotiating leverage and standardizing service levels.

driverItems.headline: Insourcing strategic services
driverItems.description: Brought environmental services and select IT functions in-house, generating 12% savings versus peer benchmark of 8%.

driverItems.headline: Vendor performance management
driverItems.description: Implemented performance-based contract terms with 85% of vendors versus peer average of 62%, linking payment to quality and service metrics.

driverItems.headline: Non-issue
driverItems.description: Service quality was not compromised, with satisfaction scores for outsourced services at 92nd percentile versus peer median of 78th percentile. (pX)

chart.title: Departmental Budget Review
chart.subtitle: Rate schedules and performance by major payer

kpis.name: Supply Expense Management Ahead of Benchmarks
kpis.description: Supplies expenses have decreased by 2% compared to peer average increase of 0.5%, placing us in the top 15% through standardization initiatives and enhanced group purchasing leverage.

driverItems.headline: Standardization initiatives
driverItems.description: Achieved 82% compliance with standardized preference cards versus peer average of 67%, reducing variation and waste.

driverItems.headline: Group purchasing leverage
driverItems.description: Consolidated 94% of spend through prime vendor agreements versus peer benchmark of 86%, enhancing volume-based discounts.

driverItems.headline: Inventory management excellence
driverItems.description: Reduced supply days on hand to 20.3 days versus peer average of 24.7 days, optimizing working capital.

driverItems.headline: Non-issue
driverItems.description: Clinical outcomes were not negatively impacted, with quality indicators in the top quartile compared to peers. (pX)

kpis.name: Pharmacy Cost Control Exceeding Peer Performance
kpis.description: Our 1.5% reduction in pharmacy expenses contrasts with peer average increase of 0.8%, representing industry-leading cost management through formulary compliance and biosimilar adoption.

driverItems.headline: Formulary management
driverItems.description: Achieved 96% formulary compliance versus peer benchmark of 88%, optimizing therapeutic substitutions.

driverItems.headline: Biosimilar adoption
driverItems.description: Implemented biosimilars for 78% of eligible therapies versus peer average of 59%, generating 14% cost reduction in targeted categories.

driverItems.headline: 340B program optimization
driverItems.description: Expanded capture rate to 92% of eligible prescriptions versus peer average of 84%, maximizing program benefits.

driverItems.headline: Non-issue
driverItems.description: Medication safety was maintained with adverse drug events at 0.8 per 1,000 patient days versus peer average of 1.2. (pX)

kpis.name: OR Utilization Outperforming Peer Facilities
kpis.description: Primetime OR utilization has increased by 5% versus peer average of 2.1%, placing us in the top quartile through block schedule optimization and turnover time reduction.

driverItems.headline: Block schedule optimization
driverItems.description: Implemented data-driven block allocation with 14-day release policy versus peer average of 21 days, increasing utilization by 3.2 percentage points.

driverItems.headline: Turnover time reduction
driverItems.description: Achieved average turnover of 22 minutes versus peer benchmark of 28 minutes through parallel processing and dedicated teams.

driverItems.headline: First case on-time start improvement
driverItems.description: Improved first case on-time starts to 87% versus peer average of 74% through standardized pre-operative protocols.

driverItems.headline: Non-issue
driverItems.description: Case duration accuracy was not a significant factor, with actual-to-scheduled time variance matching peer median at 12%. (pX)

kpis.name: Revenue Cycle Effectiveness Leading Peer Group
kpis.description: AR days have decreased by 4% compared to peer average of 1.5%, positioning us among the top 10% through front-end process improvements and denial management excellence.

driverItems.headline: Front-end process improvement
driverItems.description: Achieved 95% point-of-service collections for scheduled services versus peer benchmark of 87%, accelerating cash flow.

driverItems.headline: Denial management excellence
driverItems.description: Reduced initial denial rate to 4.2% versus peer average of 6.8% through pre-submission claim scrubbing and clinical documentation initiatives.

driverItems.headline: Payer contract optimization
driverItems.description: Renegotiated payment terms with top three payers, reducing payment lag by 5.2 days compared to peer average.

driverItems.headline: Non-issue
driverItems.description: Payer mix complexity was not a significant factor, with government payer percentage aligning with peer median at 67%. (pX)

chart.title: Cost Management Report
chart.subtitle: Operating room usage rates and scheduling efficiency
